meanings.definition: Remove the husk or outer covering from (a fruit or seed)
meanings.sent1: She unhusks the corn before cooking it.
meanings.sent2: The farmer unhusks the coconuts to get to the delicious flesh inside.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel unhusks the acorn, revealing the tasty nut inside.
meanings.sent4: As the sun sets, nature unhusks its daytime colors, revealing the beauty of the night.
meanings.sent5: With skilled hands, she unhusks the almonds, exposing the smooth nuts within.

meanings.definition: To shed or peel off the husk or outer covering
meanings.sent1: The snake unhusks its old skin to reveal a shiny new one underneath.
meanings.sent2: In autumn, the trees unhusk their leaves, preparing for the winter.
meanings.sent3: The caterpillar unhusks its cocoon, emerging as a beautiful butterfly.
meanings.sent4: Time unhusks the memories, leaving only the essence of the past.
meanings.sent5: The flower unhusks its petals, blooming into a vibrant display of colors.

meanings.definition: To uncover or reveal something hidden or protected
meanings.sent1: The detective unhusks the truth behind the mysterious case.
meanings.sent2: With each question, she unhusks a new layer of the secret.
meanings.sent3: The magician unhusks the surprise hidden in his hat, to the amazement of the audience.
meanings.sent4: The artist unhusks his emotions on the canvas, creating a masterpiece of raw feelings.
meanings.sent5: The explorer unhusks the ancient artifact, unveiling its historical significance.
